name: Public perception of scientists, by respondent characteristic: 2018
description: Public perception of scientists, by respondent characteristic: 2018

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_scientists_work_for_the_good_of_humanity
variableMeasured.description: Scientists Work For The Good Of Humanity

variableMeasured.name: field_scientists_want_to_make_life_better_for_the_average_person
variableMeasured.description: Scientists Want To Make Life Better For The Average Person

notes: Data represent respondents who "strongly agree" and "agree" with the following: Scientific researchers are dedicated people who work for the good of humanity; Scientists are helping to solve challenging problems; Most scientists want to work on things that will make life better for the average person; and Scientists are apt to be odd and peculiar people.
sources: NORC at the University of Chicago, General Social Survey (2018).Science and Engineering Indicators
